DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Status Amyloidosis Hepatic Status Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the hepatic status of amyloidosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the localized or diffuse accumulation of amyloid protein in various anatomic sites. It may be primary, due to clonal plasma cell proliferations; secondary, due to long standing infections, chronic inflammatory disorders, or malignancies; or familial. It may affect the nerves, skin, tongue, joints, heart, liver, spleen, kidneys and adrenal glands._Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver._A condition or state at a particular time._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than or equal to 50% decrease in abnormal alkaline phosphatase value and/or normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase level and decrease in liver size radiographically greater than or equal to 2 cm
ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Changed definition at Angela's request. 8.26.19 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Does not meet criteria for hepatic response nor hepatic progression.
ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Changed definition at Angela's request. 8.26.19 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than or equal to 50% increase of alkaline phosphatase above the lowest value

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A group of diseases in which protein is deposited in specific organs (localized amyloidosis) or throughout the body (systemic amyloidosis). Amyloidosis may be either primary (with no known cause) or secondary (caused by another disease, including some types of cancer). Generally, primary amyloidosis affects the nerves, skin, tongue, joints, heart, and liver; secondary amyloidosis often affects the spleen, kidneys, liver, and adrenal glands.:Refers to the liver.:A condition or state at a particular time.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by the localized or diffuse accumulation of amyloid protein in various anatomic sites. It may be primary, due to clonal plasma cell proliferations; secondary, due to long standing infections, chronic inflammatory disorders, or malignancies; or familial. It may affect the nerves, skin, tongue, joints, heart, liver, spleen, kidneys and adrenal glands.
Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.
A condition or state at a particular time.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
